intro: Siparuna estrellensis, commonly known as the Estrellensis Beautyberry, is a tropical shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, clustered, violet-blue berries that appear in late summer. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and a distinct, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
